website_summaries.verdict: A mini waffle maker with a small price tag that gets the job done. A good choice for novice chaffle makers.
pros: Heats up in just a few minutes and has a nonstick surface
Compact size makes it lightweight and easy to use and store
cons: Has a chemical or plastic smell at first that tends to fade as you use it
Some units quit working after a few weeks or months of use

customer_reviews.title: Top half stopped working!!
customer_reviews.text: First off, loved this product. I’m allergic to eggs so I decided to make my on waffles instead of buying them. So much cheaper. Can make a huge batch and freeze them. Each waffle cooked for 8 minutes and came out a beautiful golden brown. Well fast forward a month and a half. I put waffle batter in, wait 8 minutes and go to take it out, the top is raw! The return window is closed and I’m pissed. I want to order another but don’t know if I really want to take the chance that it’ll happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Jean S.

customer_reviews.title: Top half stopped heating up after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: It was great until the top half stopped heating up after 2 months. The return window closed after only 30days this is defective I should get a replacement !, ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Sensible gal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for singles
customer_reviews.text: At first, I laughed thought it was too small to really do anything. I was so wrong, it's an amazing little waffle maker!! Can cook almost anything on it! I have cooked eggs, waffles, and french toast.
customer_reviews.author: S PETERSON

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Dash Mini Waffle Maker and the Dash Mini Griddle. The Waffle Maker is easy to use. Plug in, wait for light to go off, spray oil and add batter. Waffles at 2 1/2 and at 3 minutes were the best. Waffles at 3 1/2 minutes were beginning to dry out. As with the Griddle, use, tongs, fork or spoon to open. Escaping steam is hot. These units are small. Exactly what I wanted. I checked the watts with a "Kill O Watt" meter. Waffle maker draws 368 watts and the griddle 352 watts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this waffle maker. I am the only one who eats waffles in the house, so the size is perfect for me. For the Belgian waffle recipe I used I only needed to use maybe 2-3 tablespoons of batter to make a waffle. Anymore than 2-3 tablespoons and the batter is dripping out the sides as it cooks. Three waffles and I'm full. I would suggest to cook the waffles well where the middle isn't soggy is to wait until the light comes and put your batter in, then wait until 3 light cycles and viola tasty waffles.
customer_reviews.author: K Edwards

customer_reviews.title: cute and works very well
customer_reviews.text: works great and especially nice because it doesn't take up a lot of room to store. The waffles don't take long to make and they brown evenly and just the right amount. The only downside is that it takes a long time to make a lot because it just makes one at a time, and they're the size of Eggos, but you know when you buy it. I would recommend it for a single or couple or someone with limited storage space, but if you have a family, you'd probably want a standard-size waffle maker that makes large waffles or several pull-apart waffles at once.
customer_reviews.author: gardengal

customer_reviews.title: Used and dirty
customer_reviews.text: My item came and the box was opened, the item was dirty and used. It has traces of waffle batter on the corners, grease inside, and the top is loose overall not at all what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Under-powered
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could share in the enthusiasm of others, but I can't. After several minutes of cooking one waffle it was still raw inside, although looked nice on the outside. Waffle by waffle I kept increasing the time, until 12 minutes per cake., before it was finally cooked through. 12 minutes to cook a four inch waffle - that's just ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: IMe&Myself

customer_reviews.title: CHAFFLES!!
customer_reviews.text: Aaaaamazing!! So easy! Bought this bad boy to make chaffles! Perfect! (Other chafflers join Facebook group Chafflehouse for chaffle recipes)
customer_reviews.author: KEITH

customer_reviews.title: Important advice...
customer_reviews.text: Open your hand wide and look directly at your palm. Just the palm of your hand, not the fingers.... ...that’s what size waffles this waffle maker makes.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy clean, and easy to tuck away in a small kitchen. Make up a big batch and freeze for toaster waffles anytime someone in the house want some. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: BartTop Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Leggo my  mini waffle!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously I love this thing more than my regular sized waffle maker!! It makes waffles that are a tad smaller than Eggo waffles. They are a perfect size. My kids love that I am willing to make waffles in it on weekdays instead of just on weekends with my other one. So easy to use...no clean up is necessary. The waffles come out perfectly every time, no spray needed! Almost thinking I should get another one...hmmmm. You will not be sorry with this little guy...a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Thefabfive

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size waffles for breakfast sandwich machines!
customer_reviews.text: I love my mini waffle maker! I have made many different types of waffles and the best part is that the size of the waffles I make fit perfectly in my breakfast sandwich maker (where cook the egg on top and then combining everything together once done into a sandwich). I've made little sandwiches and grilled tatter tots too. The perfect book to go with this is the mini-waffle maker cookbook sold separately (I just got it for Christmas and can't wait to see what else I can make with this). You do need to experiment with the cooking time for anything you make, but I didn't burn anything so that's a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Lonergan

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended on a blog I read, so I figured it's a good way to start with making homemade waffles - it's a small investment. Overall, for the money it's pretty good. However, the plates don't seem to come together fully, so I end up with a waffle that doesn't fully crisp up on the edges. I tried playing with the amount of batter and it didn't help.
customer_reviews.author: NPV

customer_reviews.title: The item didn’t work right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I just received the waffle maker but unfortunately it doesn’t heat up. Currently I am planning to return it. I will be updating the review depending on their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Q

customer_reviews.title: Used mini waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mini waffle maker to use with my grandsons when they stay over. When I got it I quickly looked it over as I didn’t plan to use it right away. Today I took it out to clean it and noticed dried waffle dough on the surface as well as the edges. Shame on someone for selling a used item. I live 10 miles from Ups’s store, so won’t be returning it. Just be aware you might get a used appliance.
customer_reviews.author: mimi of 7

customer_reviews.title: A Good-Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I had originally wanted the mini waffle maker in this color and had no idea there was a mini grill in the same color and accidentally bought the grill. None-the-less this was a wonderful mistake and ended up buying both! It comes with easy yummy recipes and great for quick single meals. Not safe for children to use and I did use silicone tongs to open and close. Love them both!
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: It kind of smelled like burned plastic
customer_reviews.text: It smelled kind of weird once it started heating (like burned plastic) . I'm afraid to use thing again as it might be toxic
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect waffles!
customer_reviews.text: This makes perfect waffles! Fast and the perfect color and chrisp edges. No soggy feeling waffles. Perfect every time even if you don't grease the plates!
customer_reviews.author: FireWitch1

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It takes forever to make a waffle. Not worth the time or money.
customer_reviews.author: aris

customer_reviews.title: Doll house tiny
customer_reviews.text: When they said mini they meant mini, I should've read the description carefully, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: merri bryant

customer_reviews.title: First it was sweet, then went sour
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago for my daughter who wasn’t quite old enough to use it. I used it for the first time today. I was quite pleased with the outcome until I got to my 6th waffle. The unit shut off mid cooking and left me with undercooked waffles and batter I will have to throw out. I let it cool and tried again. Nothing. It’s not heating at all now. Other appliances work in this outlet. While the experience started off great, it was very short lived. I could not give this higher than 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: L.Boogie

customer_reviews.title: Arrives broken ... but not from shipping and handling
customer_reviews.text: This arrived broken in two pieces. It is trash. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Petra Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Waffler Maker
customer_reviews.text: This little waffle maker is so perfect! It makes the perfect size waffles, the smaller ones you would get out of the freezer section at the grocery store. I just buy some mix and make a huge batch to freeze for my son, and he just pops them in the toaster. I also made a bunch to make waffle sandwiches for my daughter. Healthier and a lot cheaper. I make those up and freeze them as well to be able to just pop them in the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: SnoopyHJ

customer_reviews.title: Not so perfect.
customer_reviews.text: My first impression was: Perfect! Fast, easy! After a few uses the top half isn't heating/cooking. I get dark brown bottoms and raw tops. Sent it back, quickly received another one...top didn't heat at all! Bottom almost burnt, top raw! So disappointed. Don't recommend until they fix the heating problem!
customer_reviews.author: SNRNAZ

customer_reviews.title: awesome for a quick individual panini
customer_reviews.text: This little baby is the bees knees for my breakfast grilled cheese. Here's the recipe...cut a slice of bread in half, stick a thick chunk of cheddar between the slices, melt a skinny pat of butter on the bottom plate, put the sandwich on there with another thin slice of butter on the top piece of bread. Press down lightly, wait about a minute, press down harder, presto magic....a perfect cheese panini....hint....dont use cheap bread, use a good hearty slice of whole grain or you will end up making a mess.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.S.

customer_reviews.title: Fits My Needs Perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a diabetic 2 patient and therefore, limited in daily carbs I can have. With this little jewel, I prepare a four inch waffle that has 14 carbs plus 11 grams carbs from Safeway's Signature Sugar Free syrup prior to going to bed. Not too bad, all things considered. The unit is very simple --- you plug it for heat and un plug it to turn it off. There's a thermostatically controlled device set at a fixed level which produces nicely browned waffles.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: 4 inches my a--!  The waffles are only 3 in!
customer_reviews.text: works well and consistently but the 4-inch waffles are actually only 3 in in diameter but the description claims they are 4 in in diameter. Maybe the entire cooking surface but the actual waffle Wells again or only three inches in diameter. The good thing is that the waffles cook in about 3 minutes so it's not to enraging having two do Waffle after waffle after waffle after waffle after waffle
customer_reviews.author: Camry Man

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship
customer_reviews.text: In 2017, I purchased 6 waffle makers to give to my granddaughters. They have been in their unopened box until Christmas, 2018. 4 out of the 6 have cracked lids. They are very cheaply made and not worth even the $10 price. Very disappointed and too late for me to be compensated but at least I can give everyone a head’s up on the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne S.

customer_reviews.title: I'll never know
customer_reviews.text: The one I got did not work. It warmed up so little that I could pick it up and carry it across the room and not get burned, the egg did not cook at all. I tried to pour most of what I put in it into a small fry pan and cooked it that way. I tried it in all my kitchen sockets, nothing. Really disappointed because I was so looking forward to what all I could do with this, but I won't order again. First time I ever got something off Amazon that didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: CKM

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Functional
customer_reviews.text: This is great! The first time I tried using it, I tried a "protein waffle" recipe that I had found on the internet, and it made a HUGE mess. Seriously, there was waffle mix everywhere. We didn't have waffles that day, and it sat on my shelf for a few weeks. Fast forward to this weekend, I finally broke it out and tried again, this time with proper waffle mix, and I LOVE it! I'm small, so two waffles are plenty for me, but the mix made about twelve so I froze the extra and fed my family. It was great! Highly recommend, especially with the sale prices ($10 when I got mine!).
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Size, works well. has one big flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing machine. Love the size ! cant beat the price. Cons: 1. No latch on the lid meaning that the waffle doesnt get evenly done on the top unless you press and hold it. 2. The heat indicator lamp is pretty useless. The down time between waffles is slightly annoying
customer_reviews.author: Sucheta Gargatte

customer_reviews.title: I love this little machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this little machine. It makes the perfect size waffle for one person. I keep waffle mix on hand where all I have to do is add water. I can make 2-3 waffles pretty quick and there’s very little clean up. The batter cooks quickly so I would recommend watching it closely. I spray a small amount of Pam and haven’t had any trouble removing my waffles when done. The machine is small enough that storage isn’t an issue. Plus the color is too cute!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Good things come in small packages
customer_reviews.text: First, this is even smaller than I expected. (See photo) however it makes PERFECT waffles and is super easy to use The waffles turn out fabulous each time. I was a little skeptcal about getting this model from reviews mentioning burning themselves opening the iron due to the small handle. I had no such issue with it - but I do have smaller hands than a lot of people. All in all - this is a great purchase! I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: G Buss

customer_reviews.title: The one I received was used
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and opened the box only to discover used oil and burnt food on it. So grossed out. Sending back to Amazon ASAP and will not be taking the chance with another one.
customer_reviews.author: Mel F

customer_reviews.title: Small, Cute, and Perfect Portions
customer_reviews.text: This waffle is the PERFECT size for me. I am a 154.5 cm young woman who eats VERY little. I was able to make 6 perfectly portioned waffles in less than 8 minutes. It is very easy to clean and very small for easy storage. I absolutely adore this waffle maker. I would recommend this waffle maker to anyone who is petite or wanting to go on a diet.
customer_reviews.author: Skyrah Bai

customer_reviews.title: I own two now. I make gluten free Eggo ...
customer_reviews.text: I own two now. I make gluten free Eggo sized waffles in batches of 24 or so. Then I place them in a gallon bag with paper towels in the refrigerator. take out two in the morning and pop into the toaster. Fabulous!!
customer_reviews.author: LadyZana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for chaffles!
customer_reviews.text: So I fell for the crazy chaffle keto insanity! This mini waffle maker works great, it heats up quickly and has a non stick surface. It’s relatively easy to clean, like all waffle makers (hard to clean between the bumps). Word of caution, don’t put in more than 2 tablespoons of batter or it will overflow! And what about the chaffles? Ehh, same as eating an omelette with cheese...but I need to experiment more! ☺️
customer_reviews.author: Gab

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected/described.
customer_reviews.text: Vert satisfied for the price & everything. Product arrived before estimated delivery date, and undamaged. - Already started using the product. To make small protein waffles or snacks. Found Ghee works good to reduce sticking. And for me. I perfer crisper type waffles. So I let it heat or cook a few minutes longer. Than the included recipe/manual states. So far; item works as expected. And will contunie to mix & experiment with different food combinations. -- Update: Also found Olive Oil & Avacado Oil cooking spray also works good. Sray between each waffle cooked (top & bottom). And just use a small point of utensil into the side of the waffle to pull up from the waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: I used it once and I'll probably never use it again it doesn't give you any kind of information on how long to cook anything. It gets so hot that you can't even touch it to get the stuff out. The metal waffle plates do not come out for easy washing you have to wait for it to completely cool down and then try to get the crusty stuff off under the water while holding the cord so it doesn't go under. I will never use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa B.

customer_reviews.title: Joining the Chaffle Craze
customer_reviews.text: I decided to order this little waffle maker after seeing multiple recipes for a "chaffle" ...that's a cheese waffle for all those who haven't heard of this little gem yet. My chaffles come out perfect and make the best buns for sandwiches! They're just the right size. It's great for making one or two sandwiches, but when I decided to make McGriddle-type chaffles for the whole family, it took a lot longer. I've heard there's a bigger version of the mini waffle maker that makes more than one, so I may be looking into getting one of those if I decide the whole family needs more chaffles! This waffle maker is definitely worth the money! I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT MAKES DELICIOUS MINI WAFFLES
customer_reviews.text: Love this tiny waffle maker . I’ve only had it for 2 days and So far I’ve made over 40 KETO WAFFLES made with almond flour ,eggs, coconut milk powder, vanilla extra and baking powder) . I (Store them in zip lock bag and freeze them for easy low carb breakfast) . This waffle make was very cheap but very durable . I haven’t had any issue using it so far . All seems well . The waffles come out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: AnAJ

customer_reviews.title: Great find for hot summers
customer_reviews.text: Oh heck yea! Perfect for mini waffles! Definitely let the batter cook for 3-4 minutes before popping them out. You really can put any batter in this little guy and it will waffle. I made an almond nut butter waffle mix. Turned out great! You will need a toaster to make them crispy.
customer_reviews.author: A SaramaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Awesome,, until it stops working after less than a month!!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great,,,, until the last day it was eligible for return. At this moment, I own 2, and just ordered a third. Then, the bottom half of this Dash, stopped working. I am fortunate that I could return it. Now I will wait and see how the other one does. I am a little nervous about the 3rd one I ordered. I do not think I will be buying anymore. :(
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rodriguez Jr

customer_reviews.title: Review for Amazon product
customer_reviews.text: The product itself works great. However, when I received this product from Amazon the waffle maker was used. It still had food remains. It was pretty disgusting and disappointing so I returned it. I really wanted to try this product as it had amazing reviews so I searched elsewhere and found the same product at my local target. I have been using it constantly ever since. I love this waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too cute!
customer_reviews.text: This little cutie makes a great waffle. My daughter, 8yo is a very picky and she loves to make the mix and eat the finished product. She will eat 3-6 waffles depending on how hungry she is. The waffles are tiny....we have the heart version....but so cute and delicious. Heats up quickly and light goes on and off to indicate when waffle is ready. Takes about 90 seconds to cook and comes out easily. I don't even have to use the cooking spray. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Handy

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited today when I got my mini Dash that I did not try it before hand but clean it and tried to make some mashed potato waffle to go with my meal. It did not work, used different outlets and still nothing. Return it and getting replacement. Will update review once I get new one and confirm it works as supposed to. For now just disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Migdy N

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even bother.
customer_reviews.text: After using this for a few months I have to say this is the worst freaking waffle iron I’ve ever used in any kitchen setup. To the manufacture, thank you for not making the plug removable like any other appliance that is washable. This waffle iron is destined for the junk heap or a yard sale I’m not keeping this crap anymore. I would love to give this product zero stars on the ease of cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 2020

customer_reviews.title: Time consuming and easily burn yourself
customer_reviews.text: I won’t recommend this product, if you have big family and you have less time. It’s time consuming and you can easily burn yourself , which I did. It’s okay for one person, to make 2-3 waffles. I was excited , but than the day I got it, I returned the next.
customer_reviews.author: Zhamilia

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought the heart shaped waffle maker for my daughter whose 18 yrs of age. She was so excited when it came in. She made waffles but noticed that it wasn't baking it all the way. They kept coming out somewhat raw and soggy, even after renaming it in the maker. A moment later while making waffles electric sparks began to shoot out the top front edge of the maker and this was on the first use. We are returning it. Not safe and we are disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit!
customer_reviews.text: The Dash Mini Waffle Maker is terrific and the waffle quality it produces excellent! Did a batch of waffles as soon as it arrived then put them in a container in the refrigerator. Now anyone in the family can grab a pre-made mini-waffle or two and pop it/them into the microwave any time.
customer_reviews.author: tiskab

customer_reviews.title: Received broken, replacement came broken too
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this and it came broken, plastic lid portion not attached and shattered. Sent it back & got a replacement and that one was broken, too! I’m so disappointed, I was looking forward to this but won’t risk ordering a third.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Wagner

customer_reviews.title: This makes the perfect sized waffles for a toaster
customer_reviews.text: This makes the perfect sized waffles for a toaster. They take a little longer to cook since there is no temp setting but, that being said, once you figure out the right amount of batter to put in, RARELY does it make odd shaped waffles. The waffles are thicker than what you would normally get frozen, so if you are making waffles to freeze, I would suggest letting them cook for the exact amount of time when the light turns off. That way when you toast them, they won't be over cooked. It even has recipes in the back of the booklet. Def. worth the add-on price I paid. Super happy.
customer_reviews.author: JJAM

customer_reviews.title: Great little Waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this little waffle maker. I can make waffles in the morning and freeze any left overs. My family can pop them in the toaster any time and make EGGO Waffles made by mom. It comes with a recipe book that gives you some ideas. I even made Dairy Free waffles in it. Yummy! Our favorite are the cinnamon ones. Just remember to read the whole recipe. It only takes a 1/4 of cup of batter or less. Or you will have it everywhere, LOL! It is easy to use and easy to clean. Small enough to store anywhere. I have a big one and it takes up too much space.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Mason

customer_reviews.title: Sweet and Savory Master
customer_reviews.text: Love this waffle maker! So far was able to make chocolate waffle (recipe taken from the booklet that comes with the waffle maker), grilled cheese (my own imagination) and breakfast omelet. Pros: 1) quick heating 2) small, does not take much space at all 3) easy to clean 4) non stick surface - don't really need butter or any grease 5) fast! Cons: 1) does not have an on/off button - automatic setting does not allow full control 2) no setting for darkness of what you are cooking. I like my food slightly burnt, and it takes longer to achieve that. Overall, LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: i'm a new born chaffler
customer_reviews.text: never thought i'd need a waffle maker for anything really since i don't eat waffles. but then in my Keto facebook groups i started seeing Chaffles....now this is a game changer. i can make a no carb "bread" as a bun for my burger, or a personal pizza, etc etc WITHOUT screwing up by eating a million carbs...tried it last night, i loved it, my dad loved it, my mom loved it. pretty sure they will get one now too. the little handle is kinda inconvenient because i steam burnt the hell out of my fingers until i started using a fork to lift it up. totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Haylee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic in every way except ease of cleaning. Be sure you mmakea good thick batter and only put in a small amount or it'll fall over the edges and be all but impossible to clean. Unless I'm silly and can't fugue it out, the waffle plates don't come off which means you have to take them off. I really like the size, and the sturdy feel of the unit. I love the red color of mine, and the cheap price. I really enjoy the crisp texture of the waffles.
customer_reviews.author: Cas Herring

customer_reviews.title: Damage
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this but the top corner inside is chipped! Can't use it or eat toxic
customer_reviews.author: CelenaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Ok for a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to make keto chaffles for about two weeks then it started to burn everything. The heat sensor seems to be broken. Everything burns to charcoal in a matter of a couple of minutes but the inside is raw. I'm sad. Since it was under $10 I'm just going to live with it. I still use it but turn everything three or four times until it's cooked in the middle (they still come out black on the outside). I still love the size and convenience and wish it worked like it did the first couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Mini, useful and fun.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this mini maker four times now and it’s very consistent in operation. Simple design and cleans up easy. I kept the box for storage as this maker isn’t cupboard friendly on its own. But it easily stores in the box which keeps it from damage. I’ve waffled some sandwiches and pizza waffles not just breakfast food, so far the family was happy. Problem I’ve found is now everybody wants their own! It’s ok, for the price it’s good fun. That said if your cooking for a crowd or are just not patient there’s better options. But for me it’s working fine.
customer_reviews.author: SJD

customer_reviews.title: Easy waffles
customer_reviews.text: These waffles are super cute! Perfect size for a fast breakfast. They are more dense than regular waffles, probably because the recipe does not make you separate the eggs and whip the whites....which is why it is faster. Over all they are fast, fun, and yummy. The recipe seems really easy to adapt to different kinds and flavors. I have used it 6 times, and will edit the review if there are problems or when it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: CrlstarDas

customer_reviews.title: A toy like thing
customer_reviews.text: This is like a toy. The versatility and easy to clean is a joke. It can hold only very little; otherwise it will spill over. It may be good for a little girl to pretend cooking. The cleaning is the worst, especially after it has spilt over.
customer_reviews.author: Soudamini M. Nath

customer_reviews.title: Fun little thing, doesn't seem to cook evenly
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I got my money's worth just playing around with the thing for a night and seeing what I could do! Cute, fun little thing if you just feel like making yourself a waffle... snack? But if you're serious about making waffles for 2+ people, then this probably isn't the best option. Just takes a bit long if you're making waffles for an actual meal with more than just you and your emotions. Maybe it was my batter recipe, but it seemed to overcook the bottom and undercook the top every single time - no matter how much batter i was using.
customer_reviews.author: Luz

customer_reviews.title: so much fun to use!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using the waffle recipe included in the package, and 1/4 cup batter takes about 4 minutes to cook. We haven't ended up with any soggy/doughy waffles, but none are "golden brown" like Waffle House. Other than that, I LOVE this little waffle maker!! It's so much fun to use, and so cute!! We even put chocolate cupcake batter in it the other day, and made cupcake waffles! 4 stars for durability, because I've only used it about a half dozen times and I've noticed the no-stick coating is starting to chip off in a few places. It's so inexpensive, though, I'd almost certainly buy another if this one ends up damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Dookwah

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. I wanted a waffle maker to make waffles for my son. This is so easy to use. No set up. Used regular pancake mix and followed waffle batter instructions. Used it as soon as it arrived and the waffles were a hit. They are the perfect size waffles, no mess, hardly any clean up. Perfect to use and put away for next time. We love love love it. At first I thought the waffle maker looked too small but it’s not, it is perfect for my needs. Takes about a minute or two to cook waffle to perfection. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: VaniaCorrea

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for the pumpkin lover.
customer_reviews.text: This is a super cute little waffle maker. Took a while to ship,but that’s alright. I ordered well in time for it to get here before the autumn season. Came with instructions booklet and some recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle maker.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. It doesn't take up any room in your kitchen. It cleans up easily. I wouldn't call these "mini" waffles though. They are more standard. They make the exact same size as Eggo frozen waffles. In fact if you have picky kids, you can probably full them with this. I've used this for Keto pizza as well and it worked great. The cheese didn't stick to it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Hackney

customer_reviews.title: Best little waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the best little waffle maker! It makes waffles the same size as the store bought frozen waffles but so much tastier. I didn't care for the recipe for waffles that comes with it so I just use the store bought mix. I make a couple batches each time and freeze them, then just pop them into the toaster (I put parchment paper between each waffle before freezing so they don't stick) I have used muffin mix also and they are delish!! still have to try the cinnamon rolls. I am actually going to order another one so I have a back-up just in case this one quits working.
customer_reviews.author: donna kempffer

customer_reviews.title: My wife uses this all the time.
customer_reviews.text: We have had a number of other waffle makers in the house for YEARS but we would rarely have waffles. My wife was wanting THIS waffle maker but it appeared that they were not available anywhere. I was thinking that it would just go in a cabinet and not get used anyway but when it popped back up as available I bought her one. I have not had waffles as many times in the past 20 years as I have in the past 6 weeks. She absolutely loves this thing. Little appliances don't usually get much thought from me but as happy as this has made her, it definitely was worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: WizeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Small and Cute
customer_reviews.text: It's a cute and small waffle maker. I didn't want to buy a more expensive wafflemaker as I've never owned a wafflemaker. I didn't know if I'd even like using this. However, it's makes an almost effortless breakfast or dinner. The only (obvious) drawback is that 1. it only makes one waffle at a time (duh) and 2. the waffles are pretty small. For a small gal like myself, 2 to 3 if enough for myself. For others, you might need more. I have yet to figure out how to keep the waffles from getting soggy, but once I do, there will be no issues. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: shandajeanette

customer_reviews.title: Tiny thing is magic!
customer_reviews.text: First off, this waffle maker is tiny tiny like so cute it's a toy waffle maker lol. But it actually works pretty great! One thing that took one star out is that I wish it had like a on or off switch. The light is blur when cooking and when it's done it'll automatically turn the light off. But then if you have it still plugged in, it'll start up again on its own. Other than that it's awesome!! I like to use hungry jacks pancake & waffle Mix! Swift In the flour mix for some fluffy ass waffles. Add some Honey! (optional) and enjoy!!!
customer_reviews.author: akim.nyc

customer_reviews.title: This is getting massive use in my household!
customer_reviews.text: What an adorable little waffle maker. Okay, maybe I'm a little thick but I thought the pumpkin was just the color. Nope! I get waffle with an adorable pumpkin pattern. Of course the first thing I made was pumpkin spice waffles! And I'm full on the Keto Chaffle train - making chicken quesedilla chaffles and brocolli alfredo chaffles. Very easy to use - gets very hot and fairly simple to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dancy

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS SO ADORABLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE my new waffle maker. I'll be honest, it is much smaller than I expected it. You can carry it in one hand with easy. (It's a about the size of one hand) but I really do love it. They turn out pretty fluffy so even though they're small, they have substance to it. Plus, how can you beat a heart waffle???
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Love this little waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little waffle maker. It's great for traveling - my husband and I have been on the road in an RV for 5 months and really missed making waffles. So I bought this as a Valentine's Day gift for my husband and it's fantastic. It makes nice little waffles in the morning and the process is a sinch. Clean up is bit tricky, but usually I rub it with a wet paper towel, give it a quick rinse then dry it in our drying rack making sure the cord never gets wet. It wraps up tight and it's easy to store, especially when you don't have extra storage in an RV.
customer_reviews.author: Laine

customer_reviews.title: Great value for such a small appliance
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of use and small storage space needed for this appliance. I bought 2 of them to replace my large waffle maker and I can produce several small heart waffles in the time it use to take to make 1 large waffle. Because of the shape of the waffles and their small size its a hit with everyone in the family. Cleanup is super easy, just wipe off with wet soapy rag after it cools and its ready for the next use..
customer_reviews.author: R. V. Schittone Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Gamechanger!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a game changer in the keto world. We make sweet and savory chaffles on a daily basis now because it's so easy. We will also make a batch ahead of time and freeze them (not really good with fruit ones). We make bacon, egg and cheese chaffles and throw an egg and some canadian bacon on them for breakfast sandwiches. It's super easy to clean with a non abrasive brush and wet paper towel. There is a hole on the bottom that if you use it daily you will need to clean with a toothpick or qtip because oil comes out of that. We have two of these because there are two of us in our household.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Pumpkin Orange Cooker
customer_reviews.text: Super fun! Much smaller than you would think, so it's nice for portion control. Cooks quick, but ends up more like shaped pancakes rather than waffles (don't come out crunchy like a waffle) the shape is a little odd- pumpkin on one side and waffle on the other. I enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little Waffle Iron!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a year and a half ago and completely forgot about it in the back of my pantry. Well, since we're all in quarantine, I've been doing some cleaning and I stumbled across my little waffle iron. I decided to finally give it a try and made a half dozen waffles, and I have to say, this thing worked great and cleaning wasn't difficult at all! Obvious tip: use the slightest bit of cooking oil spray (PAM) and the waffles come out perfectly every time!
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I came across this cute little waffle maker and the waffles looked so good. I ordered it along with waffle mix and syrup, and two days later I’m having waffles! It is VERY easy to use. It comes with a little recipe book. You just plug in and it heats up. My waffles turned out great. The waffles are easy to get out of the maker. The waffle makes does look tiny (great because it won’t take up much room in the cabinet) but the waffles themself are plenty big. I made 4 waffles but was only able to eat two before I got full. Would highly recommend, it works great and it a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Vada

customer_reviews.title: Adorable Waffles. Difficult to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these cuties to make keto waffles/waffles and sandwich top/bottoms. I love, love, love the ease of use, the quick heating and the ADORABLE waffles! I make batches and batches to freeze for toaster waffles-2 at a time, of course- and they taste just as great from frozen. 4 stars because these wee buggers are difficult to clean in all the nooks and crannies. I find I think they're clean and the next day, some grease or something will have dripped out underneath them and stain my cabinet. Fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: IvanaYvonne

customer_reviews.title: What a great little waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make waffles with our Son. They're a perfect size for him. What I love most about this is the quality of the waffle grid. With a little spray of oil, the waffles come out without any issues. For those looking to purchase, make sure to clean it similar to a cast iron skillet. Just wipe with a little water for clean up. Avoid any abrasives as that will break down the teflon coating. Highly recommend this for anyone looking for a fun little gadget to make mini waffles.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Gilson

customer_reviews.title: You won’t go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Wish I found sooner .. I love it absolutely love it! I’m so glad that I bought it here on Amazon for half the cost of that Bath & Beyond even with the 20% off coupon or Kohl’s who was selling it for even more than Bed, Bath & Beyond and you don’t even get a coupon. I definitely would purchase another one but the pancake or the bowl one. I’d give it as a gift and feel very good that I gave a friend or family member such a quality item. I absolutely love it and I’m so glad that I’m able to add it to my collection and even my kids love it so that’s even a win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Great little cooker!
customer_reviews.text: Im having lots of fun with this.. its perfect for cooking with my small grandkids.. does a great job on canned cinnamon rolls... I have even dropped cookie dough in it for a quick treat. It gets hot FAST so be super careful around small children...it does not have a temp control... it gets hot enough to cook in less than a minute.... and it cooks FAST.. so watch what yu are making very carefully. If you are cooking a premade cinnamon roll.. like the Pillsbury type... it only takes about 2-3 minutes tops!!... Ive made brownie batter and poured small amounts in it as well...works great for icecream sandwiches!
customer_reviews.author: Karen B

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for $10
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because i am doing the Optavia diet and waffling a lot of the foods makes them a little more enjoyable. However, my normal waffle iron is great for larger quantities, but on the fly for the small servings i'm allowed on Optavia, this was great. Doesn't take long to heat up. One temp setting. Literally, plug it in and wait for the light. Super easy to use. No way to tell when something is ready other than the light turning off but i let it stay on for a bit and my food was fine, better actually, a little crispier which i like. Cleaning is as annoying as any other waffle iron.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: So adorable and perfect!!! Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I actually really wanted to buy a relatively expensive and fancy waffle maker. However, then I thought to myself, “How often am I really going to make waffles? And how many waffles am I really going to need to make (no kids)? Do I really need another in enormous kitchen appliance?” Then I saw this little gem for $15 and all the great reviews it had, and I was sold. I just tested it out, and I made two delicious waffles in less than five minutes. So, I’m feeling really great about this purchase. And, I’m thrilled this won’t take up much storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L Svor

customer_reviews.title: I bought Similar Models for $5.00 After Christmas
customer_reviews.text: I bought similar models for $5.00 after Christmas and gave them away a gifts the following Christmas. Little did I expect it to be such a good product. I didn't keep one for myself and ended up buying one on Amazon for considerably more. This product makes very good waffles that are cooked evenly throughout. Not difficult to clean due to the small size. The best feature is the waffles are small and if I get an urge for waffles I can make two small ones and call it a day without busting my daily caloric bank. Small and compact for storage as well. Great for the occasional personal waffle.
customer_reviews.author: A Bronx Tale

customer_reviews.title: Tiny
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. I don’t understand all these five star review. The mini size is actually really mini almost like a toy. It’s so tiny that it’s so hot while making waffles. The handle alone could not protect you from heat, needed to wear gloves or use kitchen towel.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great
customer_reviews.text: No matter how many times you read that it's small, it's going to be smaller than you think lol. But I'm loving it so far and have already made about 50 waffles without an issue. Note too that I haven't used PAM spray or any other oil, the waffles come out easily enough without it. My one quibble is that I like crispier waffles and this machine can't do it, at least not in my limited experience.
customer_reviews.author: K.J.J.

customer_reviews.title: It seems small but its very filling! I live mine!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mini waffle maker!!! It's super cute and it's a perfect size. I was full after 2! LOL So yes, it's small because you ARE buying a mini version meanjng it will be smaller than regular ones. When I first opened it, I thought it was waaaay too small but I decided to make some waffles anyway. I was pleasantly surprised! They came out so good and a good size! It also comes out fast and it sort of clicks when its ready. I keft mine a little longer because I like mine crispy on the outside. I just wish I would have bought 2 so I can get everything done faster! 😊
customer_reviews.author: Liliana

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected but still great for moms with little kids
customer_reviews.text: The waffles are much smaller than the product pictures lead you to believe..the main image shows the maker and the waffle right near it but the waffle is actually half the size. They're cute tho, and I bought it to make waffles for my boys who are 3 and 5 and don't eat a lot so it's not a huge problem that they're so small. But definitely something to warn others about, they're only half the size of a frozen eggo waffle. That aside, it's very easy to use, easy to clean, and they cooked quickly. One batch of aunt Jemima waffle mix made 12 waffles. I would definitely recommend it to other moms.
customer_reviews.author: Livin' the mom life ♡

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best $7 I have spent! It is so easy and fast to make waffles and the maker is small enough that it can be carted anywhere! The light on top is great for letting you know when the maker is hot enough and as long as you use cooking spray, it is so easy to get the waffles out! The only thing that is a bit tough is cleaning it, but it is barely a pain at all. Overall, I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Very Hard to Clean Properly
customer_reviews.text: This was a great idea but design flaws make it a bad idea. Your going to need a set of fine picks to get at all the crud that will find its way into the gap between the plates and plastic housing. Cleaning this without removable plates is nearly impossible. I wonder what kind of bugs this develops when some of the cooking batter goes under the plates, where you can’t clean? I’m so annoyed with this one and it’s bigger brother the no drip and both are headed for the giveaway pile. Both so hard to clean that you’ll stop using them just because of the cleaning chore.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nomadic

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: It's no Breville waffle maker but this tiny thing is AWESOME!! Why would I get this if I already have a fancy smancy Breville? Well, it's for my 19 month old. I like that it is small enough for her to help me make her own waffles. So, for all of you Montessori folks out there, this is perfect for the little ones. It's the perfect size for freezing! I also love how versatile this little thing is. FYI The scoop I used is a vollrath 3/4 oz cookie scoop. About 1 oz batter is the perfect amount.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Kaguya

customer_reviews.title: Makes cute little waffles 😍
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and makes great chaffles. I live in a van and follow keto it's nice to be able to use this and run it off my solar. Great alternative to a full-sized waffle iron. I could have seen having one of these when my kids were small. They would have loved it. The only thing I noticed is that the light on the top there's off when it reaches temperature and also when the waffle is done cooking, but it doesn't seem to be very bright and I have to cover it with my hand and peak in to see if it's actually gone out.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Pallozzi

customer_reviews.title: Best 9 dollars EVER SPENT! Perfect waffles!
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker is incredible- about 3 and 1/2 minutes tops and it is done. I made 9 waffles and they were all perfect. Small waffles but three on the plate are beyond filling. Thick and they were soft and held the heat. Enjoy!!! Pls hit the helpful option if those pictures were enough. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Making a difference

customer_reviews.title: Shocked I didn't like it with so many reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappoint with the performance. I thought will all the reviews this item had it would be a home run. It didn't cook the waffles evenly top and bottom was my biggest issue. I thought it was my recipe so I changed the waffle batter around and still same result. I looked up review videos and they also had same issue with uneven cooking but were ok with it. There is no manual temp control, it all is controlled internally. I could have researched the item more it's just a waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: The Cutest & Yummiest Waffles
customer_reviews.text: Best waffle maker ever! Extremely simple to use & produces perfect waffles EVERY time. I don't have a lot of space in my kitchen, but I really like waffles. This maker is about 4 or 5 inches in diameter. It heats up exceptionally quickly just by plugging it in. All you have to do is whip up your perfect waffle mix, lightly oil each grilling surface, plop about 1/4 cup of mix inside, close the lid and wait for most of the steaming to stop. I make a big batch & freeze most of it. They are the PERFECT size to reheat in my toaster straight out of my freezer. Breakfast meal prepping for the week in one fell swoop.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Everything sticks to it. Very small. Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Everything sticks to it even though it is sprayed with a spray oil. Then because it is so small the batter for a waffle gets on the outside and it is really hard to clean it off as it bakes on there. Would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Carla May

customer_reviews.title: Nice gadget
customer_reviews.text: I love this little waffle maker. I saw some bad reviews but I don't have any issues with it. It cooked beautifully and it's super easy to use. I watched one man's review and it was the best review, he showed how it worked, he made the waffle on the video without making it a long video. His review made me purchase it. Don't over fill or you will have a mess. Great for one person. I do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Already Broken in Package
customer_reviews.text: My product was already broken when I received it. I would like a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Dash Mini Maker: The Mini Waffle Maker Machine for Individual Waffles, Paninis, Hash browns, & other on the go Breakfast, Lunch, or Snacks - Black
product_meta.description: Size:4 inch| Color:BlackCraving blueberry waffles or potato pancakes? with the Dash mini waffle maker, you can make single serve dishes in less than three minutes. The nonstick surface allows you to perfectly cook and Brown whatever is it you make, and is a fun activity for both adults and kids! Unprocess your food with the recipe book that is included with purchase, and gain access to our database of thousands of recipes for free!
feature_bullets: MORE THAN WAFFLES: Make paninis, hash browns, and even biscuit pizzas! Any wet batter will “waffle” your treats and snacks into single serving portions. Great for kids or on the go!
COMPACT + LIGHTWEIGHT: Weighing 1lb+, this is a MUST-HAVE for that first apartment, smaller kitchen, college dorm life, or camper/RV traveling
QUICK + EASY: Simply plug it in and go; it heats up in mere minutes. The dual non-stick surfaces provide an even cook for consistent results, each and every time

PERFECT GIFT: The perfect wedding or new home gift. Its small size takes up little counter space, and its sleek design and trendy color options will match any kitchen décor (add to your registry now!)
INCLUDES: Backed by a 1-year manufacturer warranty, the Dash Mini Waffle maker includes recipe book and recipe database access (all non-electric parts are easily wiped clean)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars52,992 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
